intro: Senecio domeykoanus, commonly known as the Domeyko's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are often gray-green with a woolly texture, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
